title: Identify the Given Values
text:
To solve for the Gibbs free energy change, we need to identify the given values:
- Molar enthalpy of vaporization $$\Delta H_{vap}$$ $$=$$ $$40.67$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- Molar entropy of vaporization $$\Delta S_{vap}$$ $$=$$ $$109.3$$ $$ rac{J}{K}$$ mol
- Temperature (T) $$=$$ 350K

Convert the molar enthalpy of vaporization to $$ rac{J}{mol}$$:
- Conversion: $$1$$ kJ $$=$$ $$1000$$ J
- Therefore, $$\Delta H_{vap}$$ $$=$$ $$40670$$ $$ rac{J}{mol}$$.

title: Know the Formula for Gibbs Free Energy
text:
The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) can be calculated using the following formula:

ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - T × ΔS

Where:
- ΔG is the Gibbs free energy change
- ΔH is the enthalpy change
- T is the temperature in Kelvin
- ΔS is the entropy change

title: Substitute the Values into the Formula
text: Now substitute the given values into the Gibbs free energy formula:\n\nΔG $$=$$ ΔH - T × ΔS

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: Evaluate the expression to obtain ΔG:\n\nΔG $$=$$ $$40670$$ - $$350$$ × $$109.3$$
